comment.author: 15705594@N00
comment._content:
Indeed, it is City Stadium, now called University of Richmond Stadium. The Tobacco Bowl football game was part of the National Tobacco Festival, which was held in Richmond every fall from the 1940's to the 1980's. The football game was a pretty good one from time to time - eventually it got to be University of Richmond vs. someone else like Virginia Tech, but good regional teams played in the game from time to time and it was even host for the annual UVA-Tech game. It was not a postseason event.

The Festival also had a big parade as well as a Grand Marshal for the whole festival. In the old days, that usually meant a pretty decent celebrity because of all of the cigarette advertising and sponsorship on radio and TV. For example, the 1948 Grand Marshal was Frank Sinatra.

It was a very big deal back in the day.

comment.author: 15705594@N00
comment._content: Correction - it appears that Sinatra was the Grand Marshal for 1949. The game was played between University of Richmond and Virginia Military Institute. Richmond won 27-14.
